intro: Prionosciadium townsendii, commonly known as Townsend's fennel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has feathery, finely divided leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
